40495418.review:
What a wonderful time to be alive and gaming. [b]We are in the midst of a resurgence of truly remarkable '90s shooters.[/b] I sincerely didn't think anything from that genre releasing in 2018 could even compare to [i]DUSK[/i], or maybe the up-and-coming [i]AMID EVIL[/i]. 

Well I booted up Steam this morning and there was [i]Ion Maiden[/i] staring me down. I bought the ticket. I am taking the ride.

[b][i]Ion Maiden[/i] is so fresh and new and great, all the while managing to keep that wild old school feel.[/b] The closest way for me to describe it is a bigger and more ambitious [i]Duke Nukem[/i]/[i]Shadow Warrior[/i] with a [i]Perfect Dark[/i] theme and universe. Slight hint of [i]Dark Forces[/i] in the stew, too. [b]Utterly fantastic. [/b]

Some background. I grew up on [i]Duke Nukem[/i] and [i]Quake[/i], among others (those were the flagship titles for me). I fell deeply in love with both. [i]Quake[/i] was first and really sucked me in. But if I was forced to pick, it was [i]Duke Nukem[/i]'s levels, sprites, atmosphere, humor, and overall tone that won me over for the long haul. So, yeah, I'm definitely partial to something as wonderful as [i]Ion Maiden[/i].

[b]I absolutely love the female protagonist character.[/b] Very refreshing. The weapons are both familiar and super fresh. The bowling bombs work perfectly. What a fantastic idea. The level design is a huge throwback to [i]Duke[/i] with huge changes mid-level and all that - [i]but bigger.[/i] I could gush on and on, but at the end of the day, I'm falling in love again.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Totally original theme and universe that really resonate with me; I just think it's a fantastic idea
+So far the level design is 10/10
+The weapons somehow manage to feel familiar, yet are original and [i]really satisfying[/i]
+The artwork is more detailed then ever
+It's all so butter smooth to play
+Price point is too cheap, in my opinion
+Tons of secrets and replayability to to optimize your runs

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Of course this is Early Access, but there is some optimization to be done

[b]For fans of the historic games I mentioned above, this is an absolute no-brainer.[/b] Just fantastic stuff right here.

40487958.review: I'll make this short and sweet. If you ever in your life enjoyed Duke3d.exe or any BUILD engine shooter, buy this game without hesitation. This is the true spiritual successor to Duke3d.exe we've all been waiting for.

40487672.review:
This game is incredible. The classic build engine games were a large part of my childhood and I'm so happy to see it being used here. Not only the engine though the level design and gameplay are reminicent of 90's FPS games which is a rare treat in todays watered down corridor shooters.

The build engine has had some improvements made however. The maps are much bigger than what could be accomplished back in the 90's, and the developers have taken a few improvements that modern FPS games use and put it in here. Maps are tied seamlessly together rather than seperated levels, headshots are now a thing as is reloading guns and a few technical improvements under the hood.

If you ever enjoyed a game such as Duke Nukem, Blood or Shadow Warrior I recommend this whole heartedly.

40487618.review:
Holy sht amazing! 

For the record, I am a fan of specifically 90' style shooters and I don't really play modern titles. I was waiting for a game like this to come. It stays true to the formula but expands on it and refines where possible. Gameplay is more tight and satisfying, visuals are more advanced and level design is awesome. Game rewards exploration and attention to details. Secret places are very creative and hunting them down is really fun. Levels are big and complex but never convoluted. You always know where you are and you never feel like you're stuck and don't know what to do next.

My only real complaint is that when you figure out enemy behaviors and realize that headshots are a thing in this game it becomes way too easy even on hardest difficulty. And I am not exactly a pro at First Person Shooters.
So additional difficulty modes are required:)

Other than that I would have to nitpick to say anything negative. Like the enemy variety is a bit low and their sounds are a bit generic. And the enemy deaths don't feel visceral and meaty enough. 

I absolutely love the game. It ticks all the boxes for me: little to no loading time, no cutscenes or story that gets in the way of gameplay. You get your gun and the action starts right away. No handholding. It's your job to figure out how to survive and find your way to the next level. You have to manage your ammo and resources to be in best shape possible and then there's a boss fight at the end. 

Voidpoint, I salute you.

40480902.review:
[h1]Back in Action...[/h1]

Early Access Kurz Review (Stand 01.03.2019)

Müsste ich Ion Maiden in zwei Worte zusammen fassen wäre das wohl am ehesten mit F*ck Yeah zu vereinbaren.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Was erwartet einen wenn man sich in die Welt von Ion Maiden begibt? Knallharte Action, coole Sprüche, ein Shooter Feeling das geradeaus ist und auf Deckungs Suche und Health Regeneration verzichtet? Genau das! Ion Maiden geht genau den Weg den Duke, Lo Wang, Caleb und Co auch schon gegangen sind, reiht sich dabei natlos in die Riege ein, und bringt einfach jede Menge Spaß mit sich. 

[b]Grafik[/b]
Ein Spiel das jetzt auf den Markt kommt, und sich dabei einer 20 Jahren Grafik Engine bedient, da muss man sich schon fragen warum und ob das funktionieren kann. Und was soll ich sagen? Das was die Build Engine hier abliefert, daran können sich andere Spiele ruhig ein Beispiel nehmen. Solche Deteilverliebtheit habe ich schon lange nicht mehr so erleben dürfen. 

Von mir gibt es einen Daumen hoch, weil Ion Maiden klar eine Verbeugung der schnellen, Fun Shooter aus den 90´Jahren verkörpert und einfach Spaß macht. Eine ausführlichere Review werde ich zu einem geeignent Zeitpunkt verfassen.

[i]Ps: Für Rechtschreibfehler übernimmt der Rezensent keine Haftung und schiebt die Schuld auf seine Tastatur.[/i]

40480725.review:
I'm impressed. I would have expected a Build engine game released in 2018 to be a mostly bland publicity stunt title. Not so in this case. It's sick as hell. The levels are huge and look amazing, the guns are a lot of fun to use, and it really feels like a classic ripped out of the 90s.

It's not perfect, though. There are only a handful of guns, and they don't seem to be too innovative. Effective, punchy, but not innovative. The enemies seem to be pretty dumb, too. I didn't care for their "barks", either. Too common, not enough variety, pretty annoying.The basic soldiers could do with some redesign to help them fit into the setting better, but I'm just nitpicking.

Despite the weaker spots, it can't detract from how fun and well-designed the levels and gameplay can be. Really great game so far, and as it's still an early access title, it can only improve.

Bombadier Trial is a super-fun bonus mode, too. I can't get over how good it makes the game when you have to rethink your whole playstyle.

I have a deep love for the classic build engine games (Duke nukem 3d, Shadow warrior and blood) so I found myself more then pleasently surprised by the existence of this game when i saw the trailer today.  

I came in with high expections and i have to say what i played so far has me very impressed.

-The combat is frankly in a league of its own compared to other classic styled shooters on the market.
 In that it is acurate (You feel like you have alot of control and mobility), frenetic (Theres a degree of predictable unpredictability in the chaos of explosions and gunfire), detailed (There is alot of animations, bottles breaking, headshots, flushing toilets, blood splatter on walls, bullet shells on the floor, etc) and the guns feel like they have some seriously satisfying smack to them. 

-There is some added complexity and strategy when you shoot an enemy. You can get head shots that kill them in one shot and if you shoot them down lower that means they will take more hits to kill. It might seem like a no da thing but having that in build engine game really makes combat a joy.

-The music is simply unoffensive and has some stand out moments. It stays away from being distracting and lets the gameplay be the focus.

-The main charater is so far likable. She occasionally spews out one liners and pop culture refrences in a way that makes you roll your eyes but at the same time smile. Time will tell if she stands with the greats like duke or lo wang.

- A few negatives i would say is that i experienced a chopping frame rate that was only resolved when i re installed the game. After that i did not have any technical problems. Another potential negative would be that newer fps fans might be put off or confused by the nature of the graphics being of an old school flavour. Althougth life time fans will certainly get th appeal.

I have played the preview level 11 times and still have a strong desire to go back and play it. It honestly feels like it keeps getting better every time i play it. A sign of strong game.

40475955.review:
Ion Maiden, is 3D Realm's first real try at returning to their old glory since... well since they collapsed and went dark a long time ago.

Ion Maiden, has everything Duke Nukem 3D had. Actually amusing one-liners, plenty of secrets in every area of every level, tough and challenging enemies, and alot of cool-looking, kickass weapons.

The Main character, is hte same from Bombshell, but what Bombshell lacks, this game has, in spades. Art direction looks very competent and good, being partly or entirely (I'm not sure which) handled by the guy who created HDoom, which, whether you like the mod or not, you cannot say he doesn't know how to make a good-looking sprite.

All enemies look fantastic and the environment is no different. Looking just like a Duke Nukem 3D custom map, the Preview Campaign is a fantastic starting point.

Note: I've only played the first level. I haven't beaten it, only gotten to the yellow key door and... ran out of ammo and died.

The game has a very critical and major flaw though. Stuttering. Every area past the first autosave checkpoint, will lag you like the game is 9000 pounds of solid garbage, and not like normal lag, but rather, it'll be sparing and spikey. You'll have a few seconds of fluid gameplay, then a second-long freeze.

The game itself runs at a buttery smooth 60 FPS, but hte engine itself seems to require an absurd amount of CPU just to smoothly display everything. I have a Quad-Core AMD A10-5800K CPU, it's running at a maximum 70 percent when I play this game, and it shouldn't be this bad.

However, HDoomGuy has told me that the engine, which is an enhanced form of the Build engine (Hopefully with some easily usable map tools akin to Doom Builder, coming out in the near future after release!), has some kinks, the stuttering being one of them.

If you have a CPU capable of playing say... Dark Souls 3, or anything of equal level of performance requirements, you could probly play this with no problem.

But sadly, I can't. In large areas with the most enemies, I have to play like the Polygon journalist who played Doom 4, just to kill maybe a couple guys.

My recommendation is to wait until some patches go through to fix the engine's flaws and minimize the stuttering before you buy it, or wait for it to go 25% to 50% off before you get it.

Though HDG, DID recommend alt-tabbing via Alt+Enter during stuttering to fix it as a temporary measure, so when I play it tomorrow, I will try that out for certain!

Stay Tuned for further updates, I will be keeping a VERY close eye on this.

Without the Stuttering, this game proves beyond a shadow of any fathomable doubt that 3D Realms has returned to their former glory.
And yet... It's only the Preview Campaign, implying there's even more campaign-based content to come out later on.

Currently, if I rated this with a number, it'd be a 6/10, without the stuttering, I can't say I'd never see myself rating it an 8 or even a 9. Depends on how the other levels pan out and how content releases go.

Man this preview was a blast to play off, throughout the whole preview, it didn't have a dull or boring moment it was constant action thrown at you.

Now unto the game itself i'll be dividing the review into 4 sections, Gameplay, Graphics, Soundtrack and Optimization

Note: that im not taking Storyline into consideration since it's not a big deal in the game.

Gameplay: If you've played Duke Nukem 3D, Blood, Shadow Warrior or DOOM you can expect the same level of awesomeness happening in Ion Maiden, it shares a lot of similarities with Duke Nukem 3D (also because its a BUILD engine game) but also because the levels are linear but they never push you towards the end like other games, still just because the levels are linear doesn't mean they are bad infact the levels are HUGE, and when i mean HUGE i really mean it, it makes use of clever techniques from the BUILD engine like ROR, Spritework and a few more, this makes the linearity disappear and you can actually backtrack to other sections of the level to collect secrets, so rarely does it push you towards the end unless its the end of the level that is.

Graphics: They are retro as hell, since its based on older games don't expect, Dynamic shadows, reflections or other gimmicks from new games, you have the option of setting the texture filtering to classic (which is pixelated) or Filtered (which reduces the pixelation) and few other options, though the graphics get the job done of making you feel like you are playing a game from the 90s, also it makes the atmosphere of the game very unique.

Since its a BUILD engine game, you can expect some graphical glitches sometimes.

Soundtrack: The OST in the game is fantastic, it's top notch the song of the first level it's honestly one of the best songs i've heard in a while, this also applies to Level 2 aswell, needless to say its a fantastic soundtrack one that i'll be listening for years to come!

Optimization: Since this is a BUILD engine game, you can expect some bad framerate when the shit goes down, in some areas where there was too much going on, my framerate dropped to 40 fps and below, it's not strange to see this happen since like i said its a BUILD engine game, but it could get better.

In the end, Ion Maiden is truly worth the price is asking for, seeing the first 2 levels makes me feel comfortable that the rest will be just as good, but if you wish to wait until the final product, then you can, if you are thirsty for a game that is a throwback to older games like Duke3D, Doom, etc.

Then Ion Maiden is for you!

Oh and it will also feature workshop and map editor when it comes out, so that's enough for me to buy it.

40471571.review:
[REVIEW CURRENTLY BASED UPON THE PREVIEW EPISODE AND NOT THE FULL GAME]

Ion Maiden came out of nowhere, I honestly had not seen anything leading up to its release! But a pleasant surprise it is!
For fans of classic Build Engine games, you may know them as such games as Duke Nukem 3D, Shadow Warrior, Blood - yes those classic violent and gory shooters from the 90's - will enjoy a fresh new game with traditional gratuitous violence and gore! Don your 'Loverboy' revolver and shoot up some cyber-punks in this gritty dystopian world - oh and throw some kickass one liners while your wrecking havoc!

Ion Maiden offers everything the classic 90's shooters did best and keeps it as good as them. Ion Maiden can easily be up there with the greats and its already stole my heart with its retro feel and fantastic gameplay. 

Level design is superb! Huge and highly detailed levels riddled with secrets and enemies and offers a mix of close quarters and big open spaces. The smallest details really add to the experience, one instance had me staring at a condom machine in a public toilet because I noticed "Who wants some Wang?" Written on it, suffice to say I chuckled.

Sprites in this game are probably some of the most polished I've seen, however Ion Maiden has been developed and brought out in 2018 so refining the whole experience is most likely an easier task - ANYWAY, the weapon sprites look brilliant and feel great in hand. Enemy sprites looked mediocre for the most part but I didn't spend a lot of time staring at them as I did gunning them down, blowing them to smithereens, or beating the !@#£ out of them with an electrified police baton! Oh yeah speaking of guns, Ion Maiden offers a sweet array of weapons to plough through the preview episode with. You'll start off with said electrified police baton and a whopping big revolver called the 'Loverboy'. Eventually you'll find a beefy looking shotgun that packs a punch, the SMG-9000, and these awesome little homing grenade bombs to decimate your enemies with. That isn't even the entire roster, towards the end of the preview campaign you'll pick up a massive chaingun (sadly the campaign came to an end before I could fire the beast - what a tease!) My only issue with the weapons is that they require reloading which can be done manually or automatically, however this is only a minor annoyance and doesn't effect gameplay drastically.

The enemy AI isn't perfect, a couple of times did I catch enemies wandering off into the distance or trying to force their body through a wall, but who cares - as long as you got the gun, it's all about havin' fun! Secrets are plastered around every nook and cranny, one instance had me doing a series of risky jumps to obtain a shotgun which I really enjoyed personally.

I personally look forward for the full release of Ion Maiden, I had an absaloute blast and I've been returning to it and rerunning the levels to find more secrets each time. I recommend this to fans of classic 90's shooters, fans of the Build Engine, and FPS fans in general. You will NOT be dissapointed by this title, we can only look forward to when the full product is released!

2016 januárjában megjelenik a Bombshell névre hallgató játéknak nem nevezhető hányinger. Szarból, papírból, és visszamaradott duke4 cuccokból összeeszkábált borzalom. Azonban felcsillan a remény, amikor megemlítik, hogy lesz egy rövidke gém, ami Shelly előzményeit mutatja be egy retro duke motoros gémben, a készítők pedig veterán map készítők lesznek. A játék nem kapta meg ezt a kiegészítőt, de most külön megjelent...és eddig piszkosul jó.

A review elején az szokott lenni, hogy elárulom a játék alaptörténetét: a bombshellben Shelly nevű feszes picsájú hősnönk kezét elveszíti egy gonosz robot tudós miatt...akire emiatt mérges...és semmi más nem derül ki.

Szóval Ion Maiden:

- Menü és fegyverek ismerősek lesznek a Duke-ból kisebb változtatásokkal. Fegyver spriteok gyönyörűek és szépen animáltak (csakúgy mint a tűz). A gránát robbanás koponya alakú tűzcsóvát hagy maga után, sotinál látható a pellett. Élvezetes maga a lövölde rész, csak idegesítő lesz ha sok messziről hitscan enemy lő nyílt téren, esetleg bújkálva lő (igen, az AI nem rossz magához képest).

- Egér: ugyanaz a kaki eduke egérmozgás amitől már agyrákot kapok

Összességében tetszett. Van benne kihívás. Gyönyörűek és hangulatosak a mapok. És IGAZI oldschool játék, nem ilyen dusk nyomiság.
9/10 menzán felszolgált embermaradvány

40469937.review:
Imagine an alternate timeline where 3D accelerator cards were never created. Ion Maiden is a shot across the space time continuum from that timeline. Comparing it to Duke Nukem 3D or Blood isn't fair in my opinion. People who compare it to what we wanted from Duke Nukem Forever are thinking closer to the truth. Ion Maiden has the DNA of games like Duke Nukem 3D and Blood, but also obscure and disparate titles which tried to be different in their day, including HeXen, Powerslave, Rise of the Triad, and Strife. The large sprawling level design is even reminiscent of more modern exploration based shooters like BioShock, and Voidpoint has done well to reward players who take their time to find the dozens of secret areas per map. This game is something entirely new, yet familiar. In a sea of garbage retro send offs who don't get it right, Ion Maiden doesn't try to be like the past, it tries to be the future we never got to see.

Disclaimer: I received a free copy of this game. Not because I am a reviewer but because I'm an avid Duke Nukem 3D fan and friend of the team and I was allowed to do some beta testing.

40469017.review:
Bombshell revient et cette fois dans un FPS à l'ancienne.
Les développeurs ont repris ce bon vieux Build Engine est le rendu est génial !



Graphiquement c'est très réussi. Certes le jeu n'est pas comparable avec les graphismes new-gen, mais vu l'âge du moteur utilisé c'est vraiment très détaillé et agréable regardé.

Au niveau du level design, le jeu reprend un style à la Duke Nukem 3D et ça fait plaisir de voir un travail aussi bien fait sur ce point ! J'ai beaucoup apprécié la manière dont les niveaux sont agencer. Les chargements durent 1 seconde et on reprend là où on en était sans coupure visuelle (pas d'écran de chargement juste le personnage qui ne bouge plus) et on a l'impression d'un seul grand niveau. Il y a des zones secrètes à trouver également.

La bande-son est bien, on a Bombshell qui lance des phrases et autres punshlines comme Duke Nukem en son temps.
Et le gros point à souligné, on est dans du vrai fast FPS à l'ancienne, c'est super dynamique, rapide, nerveux,...

Niveau armes il y a (actuellement) le classique pistolet (qui balance des douilles partout), un fusil à pompe à l'ancienne (lui je l'adore :D), des grenades (cool aussi :D), une mitraillette et une sorte de matraque/taser.

Pas de limite d'armes (à l'ancienne), une jauge de santé (à l'ancienne), des Medi Kits, des munitions à ramasser, des cartes de couleurs pour déverrouiller les zones suivantes (à l'ancienne),...

Il y a toujours de l'interaction avec les objets de l'environnement, et un décor destructible dans le même principe que Duke Nukem 3D.



On retrouve enfin un FPS comme dans les années 90, et ça fait plaisir. C'est fun, nerveux et avec un très bon level design.
Le jeu est en accès anticipé, mais actuellement c'est vraiment très prometteur. J'ai hâte de voir comment le jeu va évoluer par la suite !

40467175.review:
(プレビュー版でのレビュー)

なぜか2018年になって1995年に作られたエンジンのFPSがリリースされるという、よくわからない事態が発生した。
今年は本当に2018年だよね？

Build Engineの代表作であるDuke Nukem 3Dの開発元、3D Realmsが販売しているだけあって、
当時のFPSのスタイルを理解しながらも、今のFPSでよくみられる要素がある程度盛り込まれている。
・Windowsネイティブサポート。Build Engineゲームのオリジナルは全てDOS下で動くものだったし、公式でソースコードが出ているDuke3DやShadow Warriorを除き、強引なリバースエンジニアリング以外で作られた現代OS向けソースポートが存在しない。
・戻ることが可能なレベル構成。現存するほぼ全てのBuild Engineゲームは一本道のエピソード制だったが、Ion Maidenはいくつかローディングがはさまれるものの広大なマップを行き来できるようになっている。
　後戻りが出来なくなる箇所はあるのだが、直前で未発見シークレット数を教えてくれる親切設計となっている。
・シークレットの隠し方もクラシック。とても小さなスイッチを探したり、色の違う壁を調べたり、高所へよじ登ったりすると見つかるのが多い。Build Engineのお約束である壁破壊系シークレットはマトモに見つかっていない。
・粉々にした敵の生首を蹴ることができる。Blood 1の目玉要素の一つだった。
・プレビューに出る銃は３つともリロードが必要だが、Dukeのマグナム(12発ごと)やSWのUZI(残弾が50/100区切り)とは違い手動でいつでもリロードが可能。
・破壊できるオブジェクトはかなり多いし、地形もよく変わる。
・ボウリングボムがとにかく有能(入手数はやや多め、範囲内の敵を自動追尾、追尾しないものは回収可能)。プレビューマップをクリアすると「ボウリングボムのみでプレイ」と言うゲームモードも出てくる(ダクト破壊どうするの？)
・主人公がよくしゃべる。主なBuild Engine作品のプレイヤーは敵を爆破したり、強い武器を入手したりすると個性的なセリフをキメるが、このゲームでも健在。

個人的に気になるのはこのあたりか。
・ソースポートの都合か、爆発が起こりすぎると若干パフォーマンスが落ちる。特に壁がほぼ全て破壊可能なボス戦ではかなり重くなる瞬間がある。
・難易度ハードでの体感だが、序盤から高速弾を撃ってくる敵が多い一方でこちらの弾が切れやすいのが厳しいか。
・これもDukeであった気のする要素だが、武器ダメージか敵のヘルスのどちらかがランダム変動するため、敵ごとの必要弾数をつかみにくいのが問題。


Build Engine信者として、だけでなくシングルプレイヤーFPSガチ勢としてはDUSKとあわせて遊ぶべきと言いたい。

40467052.review:
Great art work on guns and environment with funny posters and signs littered throughout.

Level designs that are drawn from the inspirations of 3D Realms previous games for the better but with that also comes with some spots that I thought i had missed a lever some where.(this part may or may not be right) The ambush in the subway system for example, I feel like I tried to open the door and spent a while searching the level and examing the environment until I tried to crouch and open the door at the same time. In retrospect it seems obvious to do that but it really broke up the tempo of the game for something that subtle.

Remaining on the topic of the level for a brief second, the game's engine still shows its age and looking down or up stretches out the enrionment which can make some platforming and item collection into a mess of warped textures and luck.

The main characters comments are kept low, perfect direction to have an option in the menu to turn them off, but when I hear the MC say "bullshit" I love it. It feels like she actually has a personality.

However there are some problems, I was shot a few times from an enemy I couldn't see because the "fog" of the game hid them while they were down a long corridor. Only happened once but playing on harder difficulties this can make it seem unfair.

Ladders are way too janky, going up them is fine although jarring how you are locked into one. The problem lies when navigating down a later and you inevitably fall off and take damage, try to aim for the ladder while you fall and hope you catch the bottom.

Enemies are designed well enough, the first two do appear a little "samey" and their voice lines are repeated quite often. "fan out" and "over here" As the game progresses more dangerous and swarming types appear which break up the mold.

The boss fight in this early access version is fun, not challenging and falls into the trap of showering you with armor and weapons before hand which might as well have been a sign saying this is the level's boss fight. A bunch of enemies spawn on the right side of the map and then the boss showes up. The boss has the ability to destory terrain, which is awesome, but besides that I threw grenades at it until it died. I got to pick up a minigun and before firing a single round the level ended.

This game shines with its 'tude where it will challenge you to kill all enemies and find all hidden spots tucked away within the game's beautifuly retro design but certain aspects still need ironing out. This a game for the fans of 3D Realms previous titles and other games within this genre of 90s shooters. 

Remember real players find all the secrets, are you a real player?

40466981.review:
Ion Maiden is a modernized build engine game, so if you are nostalgic for games in the Blood, Duke Nukem 3D, and Shadow Warrior variety, you will not be dissapointed at this early preview. There's a lot of secrets laid throughout the levels, some are accessible by moving things like office chairs or trashcans, some are accessed via hidden switches or hard to reach areas.

Currently this early access game has about an hour worth of very fun gameplay and an additional "bomb trial" which unlocks once you beat the sample campaign episode. The bomb trial mode only has the Bowling Bombs as your main weapon, which is one of the most fun weapons to use.

The sample campaign episode shows a lot of promise for the finished product, the game feels polished, movement feels very quick and it's fun to quickly strafe around enemies while unloading bullets into them. Most weapons feel great, the only weapon which doesn't feel as unique or fun to use is the SMG which just sprays a lot of bullets. I tended to use the "Loverboy" pistol the most, with the Bowling Bombs and shotgun as my other frequently used weapons.

Since this is a Build engine game don't expect the most amazing graphics, but this game looks great for the retro aesthetic it's trying to go for. I'm sure being a modern version of the build engine this game can run on various specs of hardware without much problems.

The game is developed by Voidpoint LLC, which is comprised of fan hobbyist programmers who created EDuke32 years ago, a modernization of the Build engine and its tools.

Overall, I'm looking forward to the finished product, highly reccomend purchasing this if you want to support the devs. I'll update my review once that's out.
